questions.question: Have we invented and discovered everything that's to be discovered or are we at like below 1%?
Can we, for example, start with the standard model and work our way up all the way to chemical transformations?
What do you think is the most interesting, beautiful moments in the history of science?
For instance, so I'm wearing a blue shirt and I will sometimes ask students, where is the blue?
So can you actually summarize this for people who don't know, how old was Newton and what did he produce?
How did evolution on earth produce genius that could come up with so much in so little time?
